sentences.en: "It's almost eight o'clock." As if on cue the bell in the chapel began to toll for Matins.
sentences.cn: “快8点了。”恰好在这时小教堂晨祷的钟声敲响了。

sentences.en: Carrie took the cue, and replied: " Oh, thank you. "
sentences.cn: 嘉莉明白了他的暗示, 于是答道: “ 啊, 谢谢你. ”

sentences.en: He often takes his cue from the boss.
sentences.cn: 他总是看上司的眼色行事.

sentences.en: He said his mother would be back very soon and, right on cue , she walked in.
sentences.cn: 他说他妈妈很快回来, 说着说着, 她走进来了.

sentences.en: I had never known him miss a cue.
sentences.cn: 我从没见过他错过提示。

sentences.en: If it was a cue, Lily was ready to take it.
sentences.cn: 如果这是一句开场白, 丽莉早就准备好如何接下去了.

sentences.en: Jon's arrival was a cue for more champagne.
sentences.cn: 乔恩一来就意味着要喝更多的香槟酒了。

sentences.en: Kevin arrived right on cue to care for Harry.
sentences.cn: 凯文到的正是时候，可以照顾哈丽。

sentences.en: McGee did not move and Julia took her cue from him.
sentences.cn: 麦吉没有动，朱莉娅也学他的样。

sentences.en: right on cue the door opened.
She stood nervously in the wings waiting for her cue.
sentences.cn: 她紧张地站在台侧等待出场的提示。

sentences.en: She'll give you the cue when you're to start.
sentences.cn: 到你开始的时候她会给你暗示的.

sentences.en: That was Nicholas's cue to ask for another chocolate chip cookie.
sentences.cn: 那表示尼古拉斯还想要一块巧克力曲奇。

sentences.en: That was the cue for several months of intense bargaining.
sentences.cn: 那意味着几个月的激烈谈判开始了。

sentences.en: The actor missed his cue and came onto the stage late.
sentences.cn: 这演员错过了向他发出的提示,上场晚了.

sentences.en: The studio manager will cue you in when it's your turn to sing.
sentences.cn: 轮到你唱的时候,演播室经理会向你发出暗示的.

sentences.en: The studio manager will cue you when it’s your turn to come on.
sentences.cn: 该你上场的时候，制作经理会提示你的。

sentences.en: When I nod my head, that's your cue to interrupt the meeting.
sentences.cn: 我一点头，就是暗示你把会议中断。

sentences.en: When she coughs, it's my cue to come onto the stage.
sentences.cn: 她一咳嗽, 就是 给我暗号出场.

phrases.tran_cn: 提供信息，提供指示：给（后来者等）提供消息或指示
撞球台上的白色球，母球

trans.tran_en: an action or event that is a signal for something else to happen
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance
to give someone a sign that it is the right moment for them to speak or do something, especially during a performance
